unnormalised: The Inland Waterways Authority of India (IWAI) announced yesterday the commencement of a new cruise service from Kolkata to Varanasi. The maiden voyage, scheduled to depart on 15/11/2024, promises a luxurious journey along the Ganges, showcasing the rich cultural heritage of the region. The cruise, named "Ganga Vilas," will cover a distance of approx. 2500 km over 50 days, making stops at various historical and religious sites.
normalised: The Inland Waterways Authority of India (I-W-A-I) announced yesterday the commencement of a new cruise service from Kolkata to Varanasi. The maiden voyage, scheduled to depart on fifteenth November two thousand and twenty four, promises a luxurious journey along the Ganges, showcasing the rich cultural heritage of the region. The cruise, named "Ganga Vilas," will cover a distance of approximately two thousand five hundred kilometer over fifty days, making stops at various historical and religious sites.

unnormalised: Passengers can expect to pay around Rs. 25,000 per night for a cabin, which includes meals and guided tours. The cruise aims to promote river tourism and boost the local economy along the waterway. The IWAI is also planning to develop more such routes, connecting destinations like Guwahati and Kochi, aiming for a 20% increase in inland water transport by 2025.
normalised: Passengers can expect to pay around rupee twenty five thousand per night for a cabin, which includes meals and guided tours. The cruise aims to promote river tourism and boost the local economy along the waterway. The I-W-A-I is also planning to develop more such routes, connecting destinations like Guwahati and Kochi, aiming for a twenty percent increase in inland water transport by two thousand and twenty five.

unnormalised: The MV Ganga Vilas is expected to berth at Kolkata's Khidirpore Dock at 4 PM tomorrow for final preparations. Bookings are open now on the IWAI website, and officials anticipate high demand, especially from international tourists looking to experience India's seaways.
normalised: The M-V Ganga Vilas is expected to berth at Kolkata's Khidirpore Dock at four P-M tomorrow for final preparations. Bookings are open now on the I-W-A-I website, and officials anticipate high demand, especially from international tourists looking to experience India's seaways.
